page.title: 05INDUSTRY THROSTLE YARNS
page.content: {EDMONDSON BROTHERS}is a small spinning works owned by two brothers.The wool is delivered from Bradford once a month and is twisted into yarn using machinery which is based on that invented by{Richard Arkwright}at the beginning of the Industrial Revolution.As well as wool other kinds of yarn are also mixed in the spinning such as mohair,silk and alpacca.The most expensive yarn is wool/silk mixture which would cost Â£3 per 50 grams.The finished yarn is used for hand-knitting.The works are part of a large factory and are in the old engine shed which was very dirty and run-down when they moved in.Mr.Douglas Edmondson has worked in textiles all his working life,and quite likes the job,but would have liked to have been a professional musician.He plays banjo with a Dixieland Jazz Band.
